title: Creating and Managing Building Blocks
text: vignette demonstrates create new building blocks scratch manage existing ones within snapshots. ’ll learn : Create individuals, formulations, parameters Add remove building blocks snapshots Work observed data Manage collections efficiently

title: Creating and Managing Building Blocks
Creating and Managing Building Blocks
code: # Create a basic individual new_patient <- create_individual(   name = "Patient_001",   species = "Human",   population = "European_ICRP_2002",   gender = "FEMALE",   age = 35,   weight = 65,   height = 165 )  new_patient #>  #> ── Individual: Patient_001 ───────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Characteristics ── #>  #> • Species: Human #> • Population: European_ICRP_2002 #> • Gender: FEMALE #> • Age: 35 year(s) #> • Height: 165 cm #> • Weight: 65 kg

title: Creating and Managing Building Blocks
code: # Create individual with more characteristics advanced_patient <- create_individual(   name = "Pregnant_Patient",   species = "Human",   population = "European_ICRP_2002",   gender = "FEMALE",   age = 28,   weight = 70,   height = 168,   gestational_age = 20 # weeks )  advanced_patient #>  #> ── Individual: Pregnant_Patient ──────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Characteristics ── #>  #> • Species: Human #> • Population: European_ICRP_2002 #> • Gender: FEMALE #> • Age: 28 year(s) #> • Gestational Age: 20 week(s) #> • Height: 168 cm #> • Weight: 70 kg

title: Creating and Managing Building Blocks
code: # Add the new individual to the snapshot add_individual(snapshot, new_patient)  # Verify it was added snapshot$individuals #>  #> ── Individuals (3) ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> • European (P-gp modified, CYP3A4 36 h) #> • Korean (Yu 2004 study) #> • Patient_001

title: Creating and Managing Building Blocks
code: # Create a simple dissolved formulation oral_solution <- create_formulation(   name = "Oral Solution 10mg/mL",   type = "Dissolved" )  oral_solution #>  #> ── Formulation: Oral Solution 10mg/mL ────────────────────────────────────────── #> • Type: Dissolved

title: Creating and Managing Building Blocks
code: # Create a tablet with Weibull dissolution tablet <- create_formulation(   name = "Immediate Release Tablet",   type = "Weibull",   parameters = list(     dissolution_time = 30, # 50% dissolved in 30 min     dissolution_time_unit = "min",     lag_time = 5, # 5 min lag time     lag_time_unit = "min",     dissolution_shape = 1.2, # shape parameter     suspension = TRUE # use as suspension   ) )  tablet #>  #> ── Formulation: Immediate Release Tablet ─────────────────────────────────────── #> • Type: Weibull #>  #> ── Parameters ── #>  #> • Dissolution time (50% dissolved): 30 min #> • Lag time: 5 min #> • Dissolution shape: 1.2 #> • Use as suspension: 1

title: Creating and Managing Building Blocks
code: # Create a first-order formulation first_order_form <- create_formulation(   name = "First Order Release",   type = "First Order",   parameters = list(     thalf = 60,     thalf_unit = "min"   ) )  # Create a zero-order formulation zero_order_form <- create_formulation(   name = "Zero Order Release",   type = "Zero Order",   parameters = list(     end_time = 120,     end_time_unit = "min"   ) )  # Display the formulations first_order_form #>  #> ── Formulation: First Order Release ──────────────────────────────────────────── #> • Type: First Order #>  #> ── Parameters ── #>  #> • t1/2: 60 min zero_order_form #>  #> ── Formulation: Zero Order Release ───────────────────────────────────────────── #> • Type: Zero Order #>  #> ── Parameters ── #>  #> • End time: 120 min

title: Creating and Managing Building Blocks
code: # Add formulations to the snapshot add_formulation(snapshot, oral_solution) add_formulation(snapshot, tablet)  # Check they were added snapshot$formulations #>  #> ── Formulations (4) ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> • Oral solution (Dissolved) #> • Tablet (Dormicum) (Weibull) #> • Oral Solution 10mg/mL (Dissolved) #> • Immediate Release Tablet (Weibull)

title: Creating and Managing Building Blocks
code: # Create a parameter with basic properties liver_param <- create_parameter(   name = "Organism|Liver|Specific organ clearance",   value = 0.5,   unit = "1/min" )  liver_param #>  #> ── Parameter: Organism|Liver|Specific organ clearance  #> • Value: 0.5 #> • Unit: 1/min

title: Creating and Managing Building Blocks
code: # Create parameter with source information detailed_param <- create_parameter(   name = "Organism|Kidney|GFR",   value = 120,   unit = "ml/min",   source = "Literature",   description = "Normal adult GFR",   source_id = 123 )  detailed_param #>  #> ── Parameter: Organism|Kidney|GFR  #> • Value: 120 #> • Unit: ml/min #> • Source: Literature #> • Description: Normal adult GFR

title: Creating and Managing Building Blocks
code: # Remove individuals by name remove_individual(snapshot, "Patient_001")  # Remove multiple individuals at once # remove_individual(snapshot, c("Patient_001", "Patient_002"))  # Remove formulations remove_formulation(snapshot, "Oral Solution 10mg/mL")  # Remove populations # remove_population(snapshot, "Population_Name")  # Remove expression profiles by ID (molecule|species|category) # remove_expression_profile(snapshot, "CYP3A4|Human|Healthy")

title: Creating and Managing Building Blocks
code: # Create multiple individuals at once patients <- list(   create_individual("Patient_A", age = 25, gender = "MALE"),   create_individual("Patient_B", age = 45, gender = "FEMALE"),   create_individual("Patient_C", age = 65, gender = "MALE") )  # Add them all for (patient in patients) {   add_individual(snapshot, patient) }  # Verify snapshot$individuals #>  #> ── Individuals (5) ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> • European (P-gp modified, CYP3A4 36 h) #> • Korean (Yu 2004 study) #> • Patient_A #> • Patient_B #> • Patient_C

title: Creating and Managing Building Blocks
text: Observed data must provided ospsuite::DataSet objects:
code: # Create a new DataSet study_data <- DataSet$new(name = "Phase I Study - Subject 001")  # Set the data values time_points <- c(0, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24) concentrations <- c(0, 12.5, 18.2, 15.8, 11.2, 6.8, 3.4, 1.1)  study_data$setValues(xValues = time_points, yValues = concentrations)  # Set dimensions and units study_data$xDimension <- "Time" study_data$xUnit <- "h" study_data$yDimension <- "Concentration (mass)" study_data$yUnit <- "mg/l"  study_data #> <DataSet> #>   • Name: Phase I Study - Subject 001 #>   • X dimension: Time #>   • X unit: h #>   • Y dimension: Concentration (mass) #>   • Y unit: mg/l #>   • Error type: NULL #>   • Error unit: NULL #>   • Molecular weight: NULL #>   • LLOQ: NULL #> Meta data:

title: Creating and Managing Building Blocks
code: # Add to snapshot (function needs to be implemented) # add_observed_data(snapshot, study_data)  # Remove observed data by name # remove_observed_data(snapshot, "Phase I Study - Subject 001")

title: Creating and Managing Building Blocks
code: # Get an individual and modify properties patient <- snapshot$individuals$`Patient_A` patient$age <- 30 patient$weight <- 75  # Add custom parameters custom_param <- create_parameter(   name = "Organism|Custom|Clearance",   value = 1.5,   unit = "L/h" )  # Note: Adding parameters to existing individuals requires # working with the parameter collection directly

title: Creating and Managing Building Blocks
code: # Create a copy of an existing individual with modifications original <- snapshot$individuals$`European (P-gp modified, CYP3A4 36 h)`  # Create modified copy modified_individual <- create_individual(   name = "Modified European",   species = original$species,   population = original$population,   gender = original$gender,   age = 50, # Changed age   weight = 80 # Changed weight )  add_individual(snapshot, modified_individual)

title: Creating and Managing Building Blocks
text: package includes validation common inputs: Valid options available validation functions:
code: # These will produce validation errors: tryCatch(   {     create_individual(       name = "Invalid Patient",       species = "InvalidSpecies", # Invalid species       gender = "OTHER" # Invalid gender     )   },   error = function(e) cat("Error:", e$message, "\n") ) #> Error: Invalid species: InvalidSpecies  tryCatch(   {     create_formulation(       name = "Invalid Form",       type = "NonexistentType" # Invalid formulation type     )   },   error = function(e) cat("Error:", e$message, "\n") ) #> Error: subscript out of bounds # Check valid species (this would show available options) # validate_species("Human")  # Returns TRUE  # Check valid genders # validate_gender("MALE")    # Returns TRUE

title: Creating and Managing Building Blocks
code: # Load a template (if available) # template_snapshot <- load_snapshot("TemplateName")  # Modify template building blocks # template_individual <- template_snapshot$individuals[[1]] # template_individual$age <- 40  # Add to your snapshot # add_individual(snapshot, template_individual)

code: # Create a family of related individuals pediatric_patients <- list(   create_individual("Pediatric_5yr", age = 5, weight = 18),   create_individual("Pediatric_10yr", age = 10, weight = 32),   create_individual("Pediatric_15yr", age = 15, weight = 55) )  # Create related formulations pediatric_formulations <- list(   create_formulation("Oral_Suspension_Pediatric", type = "Dissolved"),   create_formulation("Chewable_Tablet_Pediatric", type = "Weibull") )

title: Getting Started with osp.snapshots
text: osp.snapshots provides convenient R interface working PKSIM project snapshots. package allows : Import PKSIM snapshots JSON files, URLs, predefined templates Navigate explore complex nested snapshot structures Modify building blocks parameters place Export modified snapshots back JSON use PKSIM Convert snapshot data data frames analysis R

title: Getting Started with osp.snapshots
text: common way start loading snapshot JSON file:
code: # Load from a local file snapshot <- load_snapshot("path/to/your_snapshot.json")  # Load from a URL snapshot <- load_snapshot("https://example.com/snapshot.json")  # From an OSP model snapshot <- load_snapshot("Midazolam")

title: Getting Started with osp.snapshots
text: tutorial, ’ll use test snapshot included package:
code: # Load the test snapshot snapshot <- load_snapshot("Midazolam")  # View snapshot overview snapshot #>  #> ── PKSIM Snapshot ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> ℹ Version: 80 (PKSIM 12.0) #> • Compounds: 1 #> • Events: 1 #> • ExpressionProfiles: 8 #> • Formulations: 2 #> • Individuals: 2 #> • ObservedData: 115 #> • ObservedDataClassifications: 47 #> • ParameterIdentifications: 3 #> • Protocols: 33 #> • SimulationClassifications: 4 #> • Simulations: 37

title: osp.snapshots
text: osp.snapshots provides convenient R interface working PKSIM project snapshots. Import, navigate, modify, export snapshot data ease, making complex nested JSON structures accessible analysis within R ecosystem.

title: osp.snapshots
text: can install development version osp.snapshots GitHub :

title: osp.snapshots
code: library(osp.snapshots)  # Load a snapshot snapshot_path <- system.file(   "extdata",   "test_snapshot.json",   package = "osp.snapshots" ) snapshot <- load_snapshot(snapshot_path)  # Explore the snapshot snapshot #>  #> ── PKSIM Snapshot ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> ℹ Version: 79 (PKSIM 11.2) #> ℹ Path: '../../../../private/var/folders/_6/hdp78hfx2qg6415svlx5rb680000gn/T/RtmpuV3iXW/temp_libpath2fd2f670785/osp.snapshots/extdata/test_snapshot.json' #> • Compounds: 6 #> • Events: 10 #> • ExpressionProfiles: 14 #> • Formulations: 9 #> • Individuals: 5 #> • ObservedData: 64 #> • ObservedDataClassifications: 20 #> • ObserverSets: 1 #> • ParameterIdentifications: 1 #> • Populations: 7 #> • Protocols: 9 #> • Simulations: 2  # Access building blocks snapshot$individuals$`European (P-gp modified, CYP3A4 36 h)` #>  #> ── Individual: European (P-gp modified, CYP3A4 36 h) | Seed: 17189110 ────────── #>  #> ── Characteristics ── #>  #> • Species: Human #> • Population: European_ICRP_2002 #> • Gender: MALE #> • Age: 30 year(s) #> • Calculation Methods: #>   • SurfaceAreaPlsInt_VAR1 #>   • Body surface area - Mosteller #>  #> ── Parameters ── #>  #> • Organism|Gallbladder|Gallbladder ejection fraction: 0.8 #> • Organism|Liver|EHC continuous fraction: 1 #>  #> ── Expression Profiles ── #>  #> • CYP3A4|Human|Healthy #> • AADAC|Human|Healthy #> • P-gp|Human|Healthy #> • OATP1B1|Human|Healthy #> • ATP1A2|Human|Healthy #> • UGT1A4|Human|Healthy #> • GABRG2|Human|Healthy  # Modify parameters snapshot$individuals$`European (P-gp modified, CYP3A4 36 h)`$age <- 40  # Convert to data frames for analysis individual_dfs <- get_individuals_dfs(snapshot)

title: Create a new formulation — create_formulation
Create a new formulation — create_formulation
text: name Character. Name formulation type Character. Type formulation, one : * "Dissolved" - Immediate release solution * "Weibull" - Weibull tablet formulation * "Lint80" - Lint80 tablet formulation * "Particle" - Particle formulation * "Table" - Custom release profile table * "ZeroOrder" - Zero-order release formulation * "FirstOrder" - First-order release formulation parameters List. named list parameters formulation. valid parameters depend formulation type. Invalid parameters result error.

title: Create a new formulation — create_formulation
Create a new formulation — create_formulation
text: * dissolution_time - Time achieve 50 * dissolution_time_unit - Unit dissolution time (character, default: "min") * lag_time - Lag time dissolution starts (numeric, default: 0) * lag_time_unit - Unit lag time (character, default: "min") * dissolution_shape - Dissolution shape parameter (numeric, default: 0.92) * suspension - Whether use suspension (logical, default: TRUE)

title: Create a new formulation — create_formulation
text: * dissolution_time - Time achieve 80 * dissolution_time_unit - Unit dissolution time (character, default: "min") * lag_time - Lag time dissolution starts (numeric, default: 0) * lag_time_unit - Unit lag time (character, default: "min") * suspension - Whether use suspension (logical, default: TRUE)

title: Create a new formulation — create_formulation
text: * thickness - Thickness unstirred water layer (numeric, default: 30) * thickness_unit - Unit thickness (character, default: "\u00b5m") * distribution_type - Type distribution, "mono" "poly" (character, default: "mono") * radius - Particle radius (mean geometric mean) (numeric, default: 10) * radius_unit - Unit radius (character, default: "\u00b5m") Parameters polydisperse distribution (distribution_type = "poly"): * particle_size_distribution - "normal" "lognormal" (character, default: "normal") * radius_sd - Radius standard deviation, normal distribution (numeric, default: 3) * radius_sd_unit - Unit radius SD (character, default: "\u00b5m") * radius_cv - Coefficient variation, lognormal distribution (numeric, default: 1.5) * radius_min - Minimum particle radius (numeric, default: 1) * radius_min_unit - Unit minimum radius (character, default: "\u00b5m") * radius_max - Maximum particle radius (numeric, default: 19) * radius_max_unit - Unit maximum radius (character, default: "\u00b5m") * n_bins - Number bins (integer, default: 3)

title: Create a new formulation — create_formulation
text: * tableX - Vector time points release profile hours (numeric vector, required) * tableY - Vector fraction dose time point (numeric vector, required) * suspension - Whether use suspension (logical, default: TRUE)

title: Create a new formulation — create_formulation
text: * end_time - Time administration end (numeric, default: 60) * end_time_unit - Unit end time (character, default: "min")

title: Create a new formulation — create_formulation
text: * thalf - Half-life drug release (numeric, default: 0.01) * thalf_unit - Unit half-life (character, default: "min")

title: Create a new formulation — create_formulation
code: # Create a dissolved formulation (simplest type) dissolved <- create_formulation(name = "Oral Solution", type = "Dissolved")  # Create a Weibull tablet formulation tablet <- create_formulation(   name = "Standard Tablet",   type = "Weibull",   parameters = list(     dissolution_time = 60,     dissolution_time_unit = "min",     lag_time = 10,     lag_time_unit = "min",     dissolution_shape = 0.92,     suspension = TRUE   ) )  # Create a particle formulation with monodisperse distribution particle <- create_formulation(   name = "Suspension",   type = "Particle",   parameters = list(     thickness = 25,     thickness_unit = "\\u00b5m",     radius = 5,     radius_unit = "\\u00b5m"   ) ) #> No distribution_type provided, using default of mono  # Create a table formulation with custom release profile custom <- create_formulation(   name = "Custom Release",   type = "Table",   parameters = list(     tableX = c(0, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8),     tableY = c(0, 0.1, 0.3, 0.6, 0.9, 1.0),     suspension = TRUE   ) )

title: Create a new individual — create_individual
text: name Character. Name individual species Character. Species individual (must valid ospsuite Species) population Character. Population individual (must valid ospsuite HumanPopulation) gender Character. Gender individual (must valid ospsuite Gender) age Numeric. Age individual age_unit Character. Unit age (must valid unit "Age years") weight Numeric. Weight individual weight_unit Character. Unit weight (must valid unit "Mass") height Numeric. Height individual height_unit Character. Unit height (must valid unit "Length") gestational_age Numeric. Gestational age individual (infant/preterm individuals) gestational_age_unit Character. Unit gestational age (must valid unit "Time") calculation_methods Character vector. Calculation methods used individual disease_state Character. Disease state individual (optional) disease_state_parameters List. Parameters disease state (optional) seed Integer. Simulation seed (optional)

osp.snapshots 0.2.1
text: New osp_models() function browse discover available OSP building block templates OSPSuite Community repository. Fixed bug dataframe generation functions caused errors combining empty NULL building block data using bind_rows().

title: osp.snapshots 0.2.0
text: New load_snapshot() function import PKSIM project snapshots JSON files, URLs, predefined templates. New export_snapshot() function save modified snapshots back JSON files import PKSIM. Complete R6 class implementations major PKSIM building blocks: Individual, Compound, Formulation, Population, Protocol, Event, ExpressionProfile, Parameter. New data frame conversion functions building block types: get_individuals_dfs(), get_compounds_dfs(), get_formulations_dfs(), get_populations_dfs(), get_protocols_dfs(), get_events_dfs(), get_expression_profiles_dfs(), get_observed_data_dfs(). New creation functions: create_individual(), create_formulation(), create_parameter() building new building blocks. New management functions: add_individual(), add_formulation(), add_expression_profile(), remove_individual(), remove_formulation(), remove_population(), remove_expression_profile(). Full integration ospsuite::DataSet objects observed data. Comprehensive input validation species, populations, genders, units. Time conversion utilities OSPSuite R lubridate formats. Structured print methods building block classes.

title: osp.snapshots 0.1.0
text: Prototype release osp.snapshots package managing PKSIM project snapshots R.
